content.description: Work your way up to the wide crack/overhang.  Then find the big jug to make it the rest of the way to the anchors.
content.protection: 2 bolt anchor which can be accessed from the trail at the top of the cliff
content.location: Begins 15 ft from base of climber's trail.

content.description: Short, dirty chimney leads to a ledge, then to anchors. Â Nice location to practice cleaning anchors - experienced climber can stand near the anchors to teach/observe.
content.protection: 2 bolt anchor easily accessible from the top of the cliff
content.location: Begins 30 feet right of Sunset.  Slightly awkward belay stance at the base.

content.description: Smear and use the tiny feet and cracks to move up the clean face.  Watch for the occasional loose rock in the crack about halfway up.
content.protection: 2 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor.  Stick clip recommended.
content.location: Starts 25 ft right of Open Book.  Look for the blank face with 2 bolts.

content.description: About 45 ft tall but the base rises gently decreasing the height as you move climber's right.  Wide horizontal crack about 30 ft up (this becomes the ledge on Open Book).  Generally shady but is warm on fall and winter afternoons.     Two sets of bolts accessible from the top of the cliff (Sunset and Open Book) and one bolted sport climb (Mr. Clean).  Other options exist by anchoring off of trees at the top of the cliff.  If you choose to do this, bring long webbing or static line.
